refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCAL_ALARM
refsect2.para: Provide a grouping of component properties that define an alarm.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCAL_ATTACHMENT
refsect2.para: An object attached to a calendar entity. This class has been introduced to serve as a structured value of the ncal:attach property. See the documentation of ncal:attach for details.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCAL_CALENDAR
refsect2.para: A calendar. Inspirations for this class can be traced to the VCALENDAR component defined in RFC 2445 sec. 4.4, but it may just as well be used to represent any kind of Calendar.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCAL_CALENDAR_DATA_OBJECT
refsect2.para: A DataObject found in a calendar. It is usually interpreted as one of the calendar entity types (e.g. Event, Journal, Todo etc.)

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCAL_EVENT
refsect2.para: Provide a grouping of component properties that describe an event.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCAL_FREEBUSY
refsect2.para: Provide a grouping of component properties that describe either a request for free/busy time, describe a response to a request for free/busy time or describe a published set of busy time.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCAL_JOURNAL
refsect2.para: Provide a grouping of component properties that describe a journal entry.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCAL_TIMEZONE
refsect2.para: Provide a grouping of component properties that defines a time zone.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCAL_TODO
refsect2.para: Provide a grouping of calendar properties that describe a to-do.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCO_CONTACT
refsect2.para: A Contact. A piece of data that can provide means to identify or communicate with an entity.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCO_CONTACT_GROUP
refsect2.para: A group of Contacts. Could be used to express a group in an addressbook or on a contact list of an IM application. One contact can belong to many groups.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCO_CONTACT_LIST
refsect2.para: A contact list, this class represents an addressbook or a contact list of an IM application. Contacts inside a contact list can belong to contact groups.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCO_CONTACT_LIST_DATA_OBJECT
refsect2.para: An entity occuring on a contact list (usually interpreted as an nco:Contact)

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCO_ORGANIZATION_CONTACT
refsect2.para: A Contact that denotes on Organization.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NCO_PERSON_CONTACT
refsect2.para: A Contact that denotes a Person. A person can have multiple Affiliations.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_ARCHIVE
refsect2.para: A compressed file. May contain other files or folder inside.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_ARCHIVE_ITEM
refsect2.para: A file entity inside an archive.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_ATTACHMENT
refsect2.para: A file attached to another data object. Many data formats allow for attachments: emails, vcards, ical events, id3 and exif...

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_BOOKMARK
refsect2.para: A bookmark of a webbrowser. Use nie:title for the name/label, nie:contentCreated to represent the date when the user added the bookmark, and nie:contentLastModified for modifications. nfo:bookmarks to store the link.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_BOOKMARK_FOLDER
refsect2.para: A folder with bookmarks of a webbrowser. Use nfo:containsBookmark to relate Bookmarks. Folders can contain subfolders, use containsBookmarkFolder to relate them.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_DATA_CONTAINER
refsect2.para: A superclass for all entities, whose primary purpose is to serve as containers for other data object. They usually don't have any "meaning" by themselves. Examples include folders, archives and optical disc images.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_DELETED_RESOURCE
refsect2.para: A file entity that has been deleted from the original source. Usually such entities are stored within various kinds of 'Trash' or 'Recycle Bin' folders.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_DOCUMENT
refsect2.para: A generic document. A common superclass for all documents on the desktop.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_EMBEDDED_FILE_DATA_OBJECT
refsect2.para: A file embedded in another data object. There are many ways in which a file may be embedded in another one. Use this class directly only in cases if none of the subclasses gives a better description of your case.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_FILESYSTEM
refsect2.para: A filesystem. Examples of filesystems include hard disk partitions, removable media, but also images thereof stored in files such as ISO.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_FILESYSTEM_IMAGE
refsect2.para: An image of a filesystem. Instances of this class may include CD images, DVD images or hard disk partition images created by various pieces of software (e.g. Norton Ghost). Deprecated in favor of nfo:Filesystem.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_FILE_DATA_OBJECT
refsect2.para: A resource containing a finite sequence of bytes with arbitrary information, that is available to a computer program and is usually based on some kind of durable storage. A file is durable in the sense that it remains available for programs to use after the current program has finished.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_FOLDER
refsect2.para: A folder/directory. Examples of folders include folders on a filesystem and message folders in a mailbox.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_HARD_DISK_PARTITION
refsect2.para: A partition on a hard disk

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_HTML_DOCUMENT
refsect2.para: A HTML document, may contain links to other files.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_ICON
refsect2.para: An Icon (regardless of whether it's a raster or a vector icon. A resource representing an icon could have two types (Icon and Raster, or Icon and Vector) if required.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_MEDIA
refsect2.para: A piece of media content. This class may be used to express complex media containers with many streams of various media content (both aural and visual).

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_MEDIA_LIST
refsect2.para: A file containing a list of media files.e.g. a playlist

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_MEDIA_STREAM
refsect2.para: A stream of multimedia content, usually contained within a media container such as a movie (containing both audio and video) or a DVD (possibly containing many streams of audio and video). Most common interpretations for such a DataObject include Audio and Video.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_MIND_MAP
refsect2.para: A MindMap, created by a mind-mapping utility. Examples might include FreeMind or mind mapper.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_PAGINATED_TEXT_DOCUMENT
refsect2.para: A file containing a text document, that is unambiguously divided into pages. Examples might include PDF, DOC, PS, DVI etc.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_PLAIN_TEXT_DOCUMENT
refsect2.para: A file containing plain text (ASCII, Unicode or other encodings). Examples may include TXT, HTML, XML, program source code etc.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_PRESENTATION
refsect2.para: A Presentation made by some presentation software (Corel Presentations, OpenOffice Impress, MS Powerpoint etc.)

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_REMOTE_DATA_OBJECT
refsect2.para: A file data object stored at a remote location. Don't confuse this class with a RemotePortAddress. This one applies to a particular resource, RemotePortAddress applies to an address, that can have various interpretations.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_REMOTE_PORT_ADDRESS
refsect2.para: An address specifying a remote host and port. Such an address can be interpreted in many ways (examples of such interpretations include mailboxes, websites, remote calendars or filesystems), depending on an interpretation, various kinds of data may be extracted from such an address.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_SOFTWARE
refsect2.para: A piece of software. Examples may include applications and the operating system. This interpretation most commonly applies to SoftwareItems.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_SOFTWARE_ITEM
refsect2.para: A DataObject representing a piece of software. Examples of interpretations of a SoftwareItem include an Application and an OperatingSystem.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_SOFTWARE_SERVICE
refsect2.para: A service published by a piece of software, either by an operating system or an application. Examples of such services may include calendar, addressbook and mailbox managed by a PIM application. This category is introduced to distinguish between data available directly from the applications (Via some Interprocess Communication Mechanisms) and data available from files on a disk. In either case both DataObjects would receive a similar interpretation (e.g. a Mailbox) and wouldn't differ on the content level.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_SOURCE_CODE
refsect2.para: Code in a compilable or interpreted programming language.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_SPREADSHEET
refsect2.para: A spreadsheet, created by a spreadsheet application. Examples might include Gnumeric, OpenOffice Calc or MS Excel.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_TRASH
refsect2.para: Represents a container for deleted files, a feature common in modern operating systems.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_WEBSITE
refsect2.para: A website, usually a container for remote resources, that may be interpreted as HTMLDocuments, images or other types of content.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NFO_WEB_DATA_OBJECT
refsect2.para: An information resources of which representations (files, streams) can be retrieved through a web server. They may be generated at retrieval time. Typical examples are pages served by PHP or AJAX or mp3 streams.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NIE_DATA_OBJECT
refsect2.para: A unit of data that is created, annotated and processed on the user desktop. It represents a native structure the user works with. The usage of the term 'native' is important. It means that a DataObject can be directly mapped to a data structure maintained by a native application. This may be a file, a set of files or a part of a file. The granularity depends on the user. This class is not intended to be instantiated by itself. Use more specific subclasses.

Children: ZEITGEIST_NFO_FILE_DATA_OBJECT, ZEITGEIST_NCAL_CALENDAR_DATA_OBJECT, ZEITGEIST_NFO_HARD_DISK_PARTITION, ZEITGEIST_NFO_MEDIA_STREAM, ZEITGEIST_NCO_CONTACT_LIST_DATA_OBJECT, ZEITGEIST_NFO_REMOTE_PORT_ADDRESS, ZEITGEIST_NFO_SOFTWARE_SERVICE, ZEITGEIST_NFO_SOFTWARE_ITEM, ZEITGEIST_NFO_WEB_DATA_OBJECT, ZEITGEIST_NMO_MAILBOX_DATA_OBJECT, ZEITGEIST_ZG_EVENT_MANIFESTATION

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NIE_INFORMATION_ELEMENT
refsect2.para: A unit of content the user works with. This is a superclass for all interpretations of a DataObject.

Children: ZEITGEIST_NMM_TVSERIES, ZEITGEIST_NCAL_TODO, ZEITGEIST_ZG_EVENT_INTERPRETATION, ZEITGEIST_NFO_DOCUMENT, ZEITGEIST_NMO_MIME_ENTITY, ZEITGEIST_NFO_BOOKMARK_FOLDER, ZEITGEIST_NCAL_EVENT, ZEITGEIST_NCO_CONTACT_LIST, ZEITGEIST_NFO_SOFTWARE, ZEITGEIST_NCO_CONTACT_GROUP, ZEITGEIST_NCAL_TIMEZONE, ZEITGEIST_NCAL_ALARM, ZEITGEIST_NFO_FONT, ZEITGEIST_NFO_MEDIA, ZEITGEIST_ZG_APPLICATION_ACTION, ZEITGEIST_NFO_WEBSITE, ZEITGEIST_NCO_CONTACT, ZEITGEIST_NMO_MAILBOX, ZEITGEIST_NFO_MEDIA_LIST, ZEITGEIST_NFO_BOOKMARK, ZEITGEIST_NCAL_JOURNAL, ZEITGEIST_NCAL_CALENDAR, ZEITGEIST_NMO_MESSAGE, ZEITGEIST_NFO_EXECUTABLE, ZEITGEIST_NCAL_FREEBUSY, ZEITGEIST_NFO_DATA_CONTAINER

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NMM_MUSIC_ALBUM
refsect2.para: The music album as provided by the publisher. Not to be confused with media lists or collections.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NMM_MUSIC_PIECE
refsect2.para: Used to assign music-specific properties such a BPM to video and audio

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NMM_TVSERIES
refsect2.para: A TV Series has multiple seasons and episodes

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NMO_IMMESSAGE
refsect2.para: A message sent with Instant Messaging software.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NMO_MAILBOX_DATA_OBJECT
refsect2.para: An entity encountered in a mailbox. Most common interpretations for such an entity include Message or Folder

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NMO_MESSAGE
refsect2.para: A message. Could be an email, instant messanging message, SMS message etc.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_NMO_MIME_ENTITY
refsect2.para: A MIME entity, as defined in RFC2045, Section 2.4.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_ACCEPT_EVENT
refsect2.para: Event triggered when the user accepts a request of some sort. Examples could be answering a phone call, accepting a file transfer, or accepting a friendship request over an IM protocol. See also DenyEvent for when the user denies a similar request

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_ACCESS_EVENT
refsect2.para: Event triggered by opening, accessing, or starting a resource. Most zg:AccessEvents will have an accompanying zg:LeaveEvent, but this need not always be the case

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_APPLICATION_ACTION
refsect2.para: Representation of a specific Action on an Application

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_CREATE_EVENT
refsect2.para: Event type triggered when an item is created

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_DELETE_EVENT
refsect2.para: Event triggered because a resource has been deleted or otherwise made permanently unavailable. Fx. when deleting a file. FIXME: How about when moving to trash?

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_DENY_EVENT
refsect2.para: Event triggered when the user denies a request of some sort. Examples could be rejecting a phone call, rejecting a file transfer, or denying a friendship request over an IM protocol. See also AcceptEvent for the converse event type

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_EVENT_INTERPRETATION
refsect2.para: Base class for event interpretations. Please do no instantiate directly, but use one of the sub classes. The interpretation of an event describes 'what happened' - fx. 'something was created' or 'something was accessed'

Children: ZEITGEIST_ZG_MOVE_EVENT, ZEITGEIST_ZG_DENY_EVENT, ZEITGEIST_ZG_DELETE_EVENT, ZEITGEIST_ZG_LEAVE_EVENT, ZEITGEIST_ZG_EXPIRE_EVENT, ZEITGEIST_ZG_SEND_EVENT, ZEITGEIST_ZG_CREATE_EVENT, ZEITGEIST_ZG_ACCEPT_EVENT, ZEITGEIST_ZG_RECEIVE_EVENT, ZEITGEIST_ZG_ACCESS_EVENT, ZEITGEIST_ZG_MODIFY_EVENT

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_EVENT_MANIFESTATION
refsect2.para: Base class for event manifestation types. Please do no instantiate directly, but use one of the sub classes. The manifestation of an event describes 'how it happened'. Fx. 'the user did this' or 'the system notified the user'
Children: ZEITGEIST_ZG_WORLD_ACTIVITY, ZEITGEIST_ZG_HEURISTIC_ACTIVITY, ZEITGEIST_ZG_SYSTEM_NOTIFICATION, ZEITGEIST_ZG_SCHEDULED_ACTIVITY, ZEITGEIST_ZG_USER_ACTIVITY

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_EXPIRE_EVENT
refsect2.para: Event triggered when something expires or times out. These types of events are normally not triggered by the user, but by the operating system or some external party. Examples are a recurring calendar item or task deadline that expires or a when the user fails to respond to an external request such as a phone call

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_HEURISTIC_ACTIVITY
refsect2.para: An event that is caused indirectly from user activity or deducted via analysis of other events. Fx. if an algorithm divides a user workflow into disjoint 'projects' based on temporal analysis it could insert heuristic events when the user changed project

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_LEAVE_EVENT
refsect2.para: Event triggered by closing, leaving, or stopping a resource. Most zg:LeaveEvents will be following a zg:Access event, but this need not always be the case

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_MODIFY_EVENT
refsect2.para: Event triggered by modifying an existing resources. Fx. when editing and saving a file on disk or correcting a typo in the name of a contact

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_MOVE_EVENT
refsect2.para: Event triggered when a resource has been moved from a location to another. Fx. moving a file from a folder to another.

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_RECEIVE_EVENT
refsect2.para: Event triggered when something is received from an external party. The event manifestation must be set according to the world view of the receiving party. Most often the item that is being received will be some sort of message - an email, instant message, or broadcasted media such as micro blogging

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_SCHEDULED_ACTIVITY
refsect2.para: An event that was directly triggered by some user initiated sequence of actions. For example a music player automatically changing to the next song in a playlist

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_SEND_EVENT
refsect2.para: Event triggered when something is send to an external party. The event manifestation must be set according to the world view of the sending party. Most often the item that is being send will be some sort of message - an email, instant message, or broadcasted media such as micro blogging

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_SYSTEM_NOTIFICATION
refsect2.para: An event send to the user by the operating system. Examples could include when the user inserts a USB stick or when the system warns that the hard disk is full

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_USER_ACTIVITY
refsect2.para: An event that was actively performed by the user. For example saving or opening a file by clicking on it in the file manager

refsect2.title: ZEITGEIST_ZG_WORLD_ACTIVITY
refsect2.para: An event that was performed by an entity, usually human or organization, other than the user. An example could be logging the activities of other people in a team
